test.name: Test Saving Customer 1 (Ranil Wickremesinghe)
test.output: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customer where email = 'ranil.w@example.com' SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customer where mobileNo = '0771234567' INSERT INTO customer (firstName, lastName, email, nic, address, mobileNo, dateOfBirth, addedUserId) VALUES ('Ranil', 'Wickremesinghe', 'ranil.w@example.com', '123456789V', 'Temple Trees, Colombo', '0771234567', '1949-03-24', 1) SELECT * FROM customer WHERE isDeleted = false

test.name: Test Updating Customer 1 (Ranil Wickremesinghe)
test.output: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customer where customerId = 4 AND isDeleted = false SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customer WHERE email = 'ranil.updated@example.com' AND customerId <> 4 UPDATE customer SET firstName = 'Ranil', lastName = 'Wickremesinghe Updated', email = 'ranil.updated@example.com', nic = '123456789V', address = 'President House, Colombo', mobileNo = '0771234567', dateOfBirth = '1949-03-24' WHERE customerId = 4 SELECT * FROM customer WHERE isDeleted = false

test.name: Test Deleting Customer 2 (Mahinda Rajapaksa)
test.output: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customer where customerId = 5 AND isDeleted = false UPDATE customer SET isDeleted = true WHERE customerId = 5 SELECT * FROM customer WHERE isDeleted = false
